title: www vs non-www URL causing site not to login
text: I started noticing if I just type in my site without a "www" it goes to the site but i'm not logged in when I should be.  If I had a "www" and refresh - i'm logged in.  So it has something to do with the www vs non-www link - how can i stay logged in for either?

title: No Title
text:
Add the following to an .htaccess file in the root of your site to redirect www.domain.com to just domain.com:
Code:
RewriteEngine On
RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} ^www\.(.+)$ [NC]
RewriteRule ^(.*)$ http://%1/$1 [R=301,L]
If you don't have an .htaccess there already, create one with that and upload it. If you do, you should add that to it.

This will redirect non-www to www:
Code:
RewriteEngine On
RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} !^www\.
RewriteRule ^(.*)$ http://www.%{HTTP_HOST}/$1 [R=301,L]
